title: Establishment of the National Hospital, Galle
decision_details: - Teaching Hospital, Karapitiya functions as the main health center that provides tertiary care services except for maternity care services to the patients in the Southern Province and adjacent provinces and the primary and secondary healthcare institutions in those provinces refer patients to this hospital for specialized services. The Professorial Unit has been established at the Teaching Hospital, Karapitiya for teaching purposes of the Faculty of Medicine and the Faculty of Allied Health Sciences of University of Ruhuna. Accordingly, this hospital provides teaching and training facilities annually to around 1,100 medical undergraduates of the University Ruhuna, around 500 nursing students of the Nursing Training School, Galle and nearly 100 physiotherapists, pharmacists and medical laboratory technologists. With the increasing of the bed capacity up to 2,858 by the end of this year, the Teaching Hospital, Karapitiya will become the largest tertiary care centre second only to the National Hospital of Sri Lanka in Colombo. Accordingly, the proposal made by the Minister of Health to designate the Teaching Hospital, Karapitiya as National Hospital, Galle, categorizing the same as well as a National Hospital in addition to the National Hospital, Colombo and the National Hospital, Kandy, was approved by the Cabinet.
